meanings.sent1: She spoke nastily to her brother when he broke her toy.
meanings.sent2: The dog growled nastily at the stranger approaching the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat hissed nastily at the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a rival.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered nastily in the sky, foretelling a heavy downpour.
meanings.sent5: The old witch cackled nastily as she stirred her bubbling cauldron.

meanings.definition: In a mean or spiteful way.
meanings.sent1: He glared nastily at his opponent after losing the game.
meanings.sent2: The bully laughed nastily at the smaller kids in the playground.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy neighbor muttered nastily about the noise coming from the party next door.
meanings.sent4: The bitter old man scowled nastily at anyone who dared to approach his property.
meanings.sent5: The villain grinned nastily as he revealed his evil plan to the captured hero.
